TopicTitle: Strange crash involving OpenGL and windowed mode

Articles.Content:
This seems like it would be a modded issue. However seeing as how a completely fresh KSP install with no mods did this (I forgot to turn off OpenGL from when I last had it, no I don't know why it stayed on), I can only assume its a stock thing.

The issue is basically what the title says. Whenever I boot the game with OpenGL in windowed mode this pops up.

One time it also threw something up relating to memory not being read, but I can't get it to repeat that. I don't have any problems with my hardware though.

EDIT: Oops, forgot the install info

KSP 1.0.4

Windows 7

Edited October 2, 2015 by Tankman101

-force-opengl is an unsupported Unity3D engine feature, if it doesn't work Squad can't fix it.

I wish I knew what actually caused this but all I can suggest is that you try the following:

-popupwindow

Ensure your driver is up to date.

Ensure that your screen resolution is not set higher than your monitor can handle

Don't alt+tab.

Disable Windows XP/Vista/7/8 compatibility mode.

Don't use an unsupported Unity feature.

Update:

This may be caused by having a resolution in KSP that is higher than your screen, sometimes called supersampling mode

Edited October 9, 2015 by sal_vager

Oh well, I seem to be doing everything correctly (Minus unsupported features, which I can deal with). I don't think I ever have supersampled, and the game resolution is set at what my monitor is at.

Thought someone else would know whats going on but guess not. Game didn't to do this before, so it might have something to do with me adding RAM...for some reason...
Can you post the dxdiag report? I could check if theres a newer driver.

I'm sure you are capable of googling how to open dxdiag and generate a report, so I won't insult you by posting such a simple thing here

It will give you information on your graphics card, the driver and its date, then you can check the AMD, Nvidia or Intel website depending on your card, and see if there is a newer driver.

Though if you are already using the latest driver for your card I expect you will have to consult your graphics driver documentation for help with running OpenGL software.

I'm sure you are capable of googling how to open dxdiag and generate a report...

Ah, just a hidden system program.

The only time I see this is when the game can't get a lock on the graphics card, this used to happen when the player alt+tabbed out of KSP while it was loading, but Unity does not use a locking fullscreen mode anymore so this shouldn't even happen.

...how to fix the problem.

I don't know, because this should and does work fine with DirectX, KSP is not intended to use OpenGL on Windows, there is no option in KSP for this, it's not tested for this, OpenGL is an engine option that is being forced by players.

Your error suggests that it is a driver issue, Unity is asking for a resolution and is receiving an error from the driver, so it tries again with a lower resolution, but it can't use a lower resolution for the size set by the user, continues to fail, then ends with the error message.

This isn't limited to KSP, it has been reported with other Unity games as well (Hearthstone, Unity3D), and with games that are made in other engines (Dead Island, Chrome engine) which suggests it is not an engine issue, but again a driver one.

Some people managed to get it to work though, it is suggested here that (Unity forum) toggling v-sync can prevent this, you can do this manually in the settings.cfg or via the Launcher.

It is suggested here (FORCED, Unity3D) that other programs running in the background cause this, so disable anything that can effect your graphics.

If these don't work for you, try rolling back to an older graphics driver.

There may a workaround however, because KSP works at 1680x1050 windowed mode if you maximize the window you will have KSP in a fullscreen window, you can do this by double clicking the title bar.

If you use -popupwindow (There is an option for this in the Launcher) for borderless mode, use the keyboard shortcut "WinKey+ArrowUp" (Source, Microsoft Answers) to maximize the window.

Or use "Alt+Space" to see the window options (Source, PCworld).

Or set the program to maximized in the shortcut, see Computerhope.

You can also add "-maximized" to the shortcut after -force-opengl and -popupwindow (Source, superuser.com).

When you switch to maximized you'll find that some of KSP's UI elements do not change position, just change scene (go to Settings and back) and they will be redrawn in the correct place.

If you do manage to fix this yourself let me know
